items.title: Registered Dietitian
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Registered Dietitian at Zipongo

Remote | Part-time

Location: Remote

Type: Part Time

Min. Experience: 2 years

About Zipongo

Join Zipongo in helping millions of members find an easier path to putting healthy, sustainable food on the table for their families, and help members with chronic diseases like diabetes and cancer overcome their conditions through our Foodsmart, Telenutrition & Foodscripts apps and services. Zipongo achieves healthier food choice by changing the eating environment at home, work, restaurants, and the grocery store. We work with employers, health plans, provider systems, pharmaceutical companies and wellness companies to improve the health of their employees, members, and patients, and reduce chronic disease. Our solution promotes healthy eating with highly personalized food purchase, cooking & grocery, and restaurant ordering recommendations, to help users achieve their health goals, free from the influence of unhealthy food advertising.

Zipongo is Eating Well Made Simple. We need to feed 10 Billion people by 2050, and we’re working to help make eating healthy and sustainable around the world, aligned with the global EAT guidelines, Harvard School of Public Health and Walter Willett, MD, DPH. Are you ready to join our team and help solve one of the biggest problems facing the world today?

About You

Zipongo is seeking PRN Registered Dietitians (RD’s) to support the comprehensive nutrition care mission of Zipongo, which is grounded in evidence-based clinical nutritional standards including the Company’s promoted use of a whole food plant based (WFPB) diet. RD’s in this role will leverage Zipongo’s digital platform to provide a broad range of nutrition and health related consultations, educational sessions and training to Zipongo’s customers, partners, and users. In addition, RD’s may be given the opportunity to assist in building out our patient learning curriculum.

Responsibilities:

  • Providing individualized medical nutrition therapy (MNT) via remote sessions to patients with a variety of health and lifestyle needs.
  • Assisting patients in getting the most utility out of Zipongo’s digital platform
  • Researching and developing specific nutrition protocols for a variety of chronic and acute conditions in order to support client nutrition-related lifestyle and behavior changes.
  • Demonstrating Zipongo capabilities in coordination with MNT to prospective customers
  • Stay abreast of current research in community nutrition and chronic disease management

Skills:

  • Sound knowledge of medical nutrition therapy across a variety of health conditions, and diet therapy using a WFPB dietary approach
  • Active experience providing nutrition counseling to patients
  • Proficiency using a Mac Book Air, and G-Suite including docs, sheets and slides, and smartphone apps.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to work well with other functional team members
  • Ability to communicate with patients of all ages and their families
  • Ability to facilitate learning through a variety of delivery methods including group instruction, virtual

Requirements

  • B.S. Degree from an accredited institution; M.S. or MPH preferred
  • Credentialing as a Registered Dietitian by the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) and Licensed Dietitian, State of New York or CA
  • Minimum of one (1) to two (2) years of professional experience in dietetics

Compensation:

  • Compensation is commensurate with level of education and experience

Location:

  • This is a part time as-needed work at home (WAH) role
Apply for job

items.title: Immigration Paralegal
items.content:
Immigration Paralegal at Equivity

Remote | Part-time

Job description

Equivity is looking for a part-time virtual paralegal with recent experience supporting attorneys in an immigration law office. We are looking for paralegals with at least three years of experience in immigration law, including preparing applications for immigration, motions and supporting documents, and performing case law research. If you are an expert in this area, have previously assisted attorneys remotely, and have excellent writing skills, we want to hear from you!

Virtual paralegals at Equivity develop a portfolio of clients supporting a number of different attorneys. We are currently seeking a virtual paralegal who has recently (within the last six months) worked in an immigration law firm and is able to prepare immigration forms, draft correspondence, create and update standard immigration questionnaires, ensure prompt client communication, and ensure timely and accurate document production. The candidate must be familiar with preparing immigrant and non-immigrant visa, both employment-based (H1-B, PERM, Adjustment of Status, etc.) and family-based petitions. Experience with adjustments of status, naturalization, applications for asylum, withholding of removal, and cancelation of removal, preparing motions; preparing I-601 and I-601A waivers; and preparing applications for citizenship are a plus.

In addition to these requirements, we are looking for a paralegal that is detail-oriented, proactive, extremely organized, and possesses strong case management skills.

The ideal candidate will be very technologically adept and have excellent Word and Adobe skills. In addition, the candidate should have experience working with cloud-based practice management software. Experience in other areas of legal practice, including litigation, family law, bankruptcy, or estate planning, would be a plus.

More about our company:

Equivity matches clients with virtual assistants that provide paralegal, administrative and marketing support. Our virtual paralegals typically work with a number of different firms and attorneys at the same time, providing each support. You would work with a high degree of autonomy and would be responsible for developing relationships with your clients. Because we provide extremely attentive service to our clients, you must be available to respond to client communications during the business within one hour by email, phone, and text and be available to work on projects throughout the business day. All of this work is done remotely, meaning that you can work from home.

The selected candidate would be hired as a part-time employee of Equivity, not an independent contractor. We are looking for somebody who has at least 20 hours per week of availability, and the starting pay is $18.50 per hour. We are a growing business and are looking for a virtual paralegal who is excited to partner with us and is interested in a long-term role with our company.

Qualities we are looking for:

  • Organization
  • Dedication
  • Proactive
  • Reliability
  • Attention to detail
  • Resourcefulness
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Responsiveness
  • Ability to work independently with limited oversight
  • Technologically savvy

Requirements

Position requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 3+ years of recent experience working as a paralegal in immigration law firms
  • Excellent writing skills
  • Experience preparing employment-based petitions
  • Experience managing immigration cases
  • Experience with deportation or asylum is a plus
  • Experience with e-Immigration, INSZoom or other immigration software is a plus
  • Experience using practice management software, preferably Clio, PC Law, or Serengeti
  • Availability to respond to requests within an hour during the hours of 9 AM – 6 PM
  • Experience using law firm bookkeeping software for invoicing and timekeeping is a plus
  • Your own laptop and smart phone with broadband access to Internet
  • Quiet location in which to take phone calls
Apply for job

items.title: Behavioral Coach
items.content:
Behavioral Coach at AbleTo

Remote | Part-time
  • Job Locations: US
  • ID: 2019-2026
  • # of Openings: 100
  • Category: Behavioral Health

Overview:

AbleTo, Inc. combines best-in-class patient engagement with behavior change treatment programs that allow health plans and plan sponsors to improve health outcomes, while lowering overall spending, for high-cost medical populations. Benefitting groups include heart patients and diabetics, as well as those suffering from depression/anxiety and chronic pain. All sixteen of our programs utilize best-practice protocols and are delivered nationally by teams of licensed therapists and behavior coaches. Program participants experience improved health, better recovery and in the case of heart patients, fewer hospitalizations.

AbleTo is looking for candidates to serve as Behavioral Coaches for participants enrolled our programs. While collaboratively working with a therapist, the Behavioral Coach will present participants with new tools to make concrete lifestyle changes. This position is part-time, via video-chat or phone.

*Remote/Virtual position, experience working with medical patients preferred.

Responsibilities

  • Must have at least 10-15 hours of weekly availability, including evenings and weekends.
  • Must have at least 3 years experience coaching or counseling adults within a mental health or medical capacity.
  • Must be knowledgeable of or have some understanding of cognitive behavioral approaches, short-term therapy approaches, anxiety, and depression.
  • Must have private, dependable access to an internet-connected computer with a webcam and headset (earphones & microphone).

Qualifications

  • MA Psychology preferred or BA Psychology with related experience; OR
  • RN, Psychiatric.
  • Range of experience addressing behavioral health, medical, and life transition challenges with clients.
  • Strong time management skills and attention to detail.
  • Positive and enthusiastic attitude.
  • Ability to manage workload in an independent setting.
  • Experience with team collaboration and coordination of care with external sources.

Desired Qualifications:

  • BCC or ICF Certification with a Psychology degree helpful, but not required.
  • Spanish-speaking bilingual skills helpful, but not required.

Note: This role is not applicable for Licensed Clinical Social Workers. Please see our Therapist position.

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Mortgage Underwriter, VA, Retail lending, Microsoft Office, Encompass, Purchase/Refinance, FHA, Conventional

If you are a Remote Mortgage Underwriter with FHA/VA and Conventional Underwriting experience, please read on!

We are a fast growing, full-service mortgage company committed to acquiring talent that fits into our outstanding customer service goals. Headquartered in Gainesville, GA, we are seeking individuals who take ownership of their roles and responsibilities, respect relationships and are dedicated to delivering excellent service. The Underwriter's role is to analyze and evaluate all aspects of a loan application and determine whether an applicant should be administered a loan. The Underwriter's role is critical to the mortgage process; this role is responsible for preparing a careful, detailed analysis of the loan package to determine if a potential borrower presents an appropriate level of risk.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

1. Opportunity to work from home!
2. Growing organization!
3. A rewarding work environment with professional growth potential!

What You Will Be Doing

What you will do:

- Analyze and evaluate all aspects of borrowers credit, related risks and offsets, employment/income and asset profiles to arrive at a loan decision of approval, suspense, counter offer or denial
- Underwrite mortgage loans and process customer information in compliance with appropriate regulations
- Interact with staff regarding credit decisions on mortgage loans; effectively re-work resubmitted applications; queue workloads; make decisions on turn-around levels
- Render an underwriting decision and subsequent clearing conditions to ensure HFC credit policy and procedures are met
- Provide assistance to less experienced underwriters on unusual situations, exceptions, and override requests
- Underwrite FHA, state housing and specialty programs in accordance with requirements dictated by the Department of HUD and appropriate state housing agencies
- Underwrite Conventional loans
- Ensure the accuracy of all necessary criteria for specific loan types, products, rates and fee structures
- Ensure that all credit and appraisal documentation meet the necessary requirements and are completed properly
- Monitor underwriting staff pipeline to ensure timely underwriting turnaround times

What You Need for this Position

- 3+ years of Mortgage Underwriting experience with FHA, VA, and/or Conventional
- A thorough working knowledge of and ability to analyze credit reports, income documentation, assets, liabilities, property appraisals, and title reports, to insure loans meet company standards
- Knowledge of conventional and government underwriting guidelines
- DE (Direct Endorsement Certified) and VA SARR/LAAP
- Experience successfully working in a deadline driven environment, and making decisions in a time sensitive manner
- FHA Manual Underwriting experience required
- Minimum High school diploma or GED required
- Encompass experience preferred

What's In It for You

For your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with a competitive base salary, and benefits including but not limited to:
- Dental
- Vision
- Vacation/PTO
- 401k
- Medical

items.title: Senior Psychometrician
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Psychometrician at Amplify Education

Remote
  • Remote
  • Full time
  • Req_8164

A pioneer in K–12 education since 2000, Amplify is leading the way in next-generation curriculum and assessment. Our captivating core and supplemental programs in ELA, math, and science engage all students in rigorous learning and inspire them to think deeply, creatively, and for themselves. Our formative assessment products turn data into practical instructional support to help all students build a strong foundation in early reading and math. All of our programs provide teachers with powerful tools that help them understand and respond to the needs of every student. Today, Amplify serves more than three million students in all 50 states.

Amplify is looking for a Psychometrician to join our team. The Psychometrician will work as part of a research team on a variety of projects involving classroom assessment, instructional interventions, and instructional technology. The hired candidate will employ a wide range of statistical methodologies in order to support evidence for the reliability and validity of Amplify’s literacy and numeracy products and services. Additionally, the Psychometrician will contribute to all phases of research and product development: ideation, prototype design, pilot testing, field testing and data collection, analysis, and report generation and dissemination.

If you are a deep psychometrics expert with a background in modern assessment methodologies who is passionate about improving educational outcomes for all students, we want to hear from you.

Responsibilities of the Psychometrician:

  • Serve as in-house expert on educational measurement and psychometrics.
  • Contribute to the design of research projects, not limited to: the design and conduct of classical and IRT item analyses, equating studies, validity and efficacy studies, sampling plans, using pilot data in support of research and content design, and special statistical analyses.
  • Develop and manage field research data collection tools and protocols.
  • Develop and use of psychometric tools to evaluate the accuracy of complex psychometric results.
  • Collaborate across departments, fostering and supporting the use of proper research methods throughout the entire lifecycle of products and services.
  • Collaborate with UX/UI designers and software engineers in the construction of user-facing reports in educational products.
  • Produce reports, position papers, and manuscripts for internal research purposes, external client review, and publication in peer-reviewed or refereed venues (i.e., conferences, journals).

Basic Qualifications of the Psychometrician:

  • Doctorate degree in a relevant field (Quantitative Psychology, Educational Measurement & Statistics, Psychometrics, etc.).
  • 4+ years of applied research experience.
  • Strong foundation in mathematical statistics.
  • Proven understanding of the foundations of psychometrics including classical test theory, item response theory, structural equation modeling, mixed-effects modeling.
  • Research record, including publications and presentations to professional audiences.
  • Experience with at least one statistical programming environment (Mplus, Stata, SAS).

Preferred Qualifications of the Psychometrician:

  • Demonstrated skills in designing and conducting research studies is highly desirable.
  • Training and experience in the development of adaptive tests.
  • Experience with programming in R and Python.
  • Experience with relational databases and SQL data management systems.
  • Experience with machine learning and neural models.
  • Subject-matter expertise in early K-8 literacy and/or numeracy.

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To that end, we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

Amplify is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities.

This position may be funded, in whole or in part, through American Recovery & Reinvestment Act funds.

Amplify Education, Inc. is an E-Verify participant.

Apply for job

items.content:
Corporate Attorney at Elastic.co

Remote

Location: Distributed, US

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world’s data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats we help people around the world do phenomenal things with their data. From stock quotes to real time Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what’s possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

The corporate legal team is looking for a Corporate Attorney to join our team in this fast growing, truly global company. This is primarily a work from home position and we are focusing on lawyers currently located in the USA.

What You Will Be Doing:

  • Assist the two existing corporate attorneys and outside counsel, when needed, on a variety of work vital to the growth of our business, including corporate securities, tax, insurance, real estate matters, and more
  • Assist in the preparation of corporate governance materials, including Board and Committee materials, policies, and charters
  • Anticipate and identify changes in relevant laws and regulations, and develop and implement recommended actions
  • Collaborate with other members of the legal, finance, HR, and operations teams to complete corporate finance, M&A and other strategic initiatives across 200 jurisdictions around the world
  • Assist in ensuring compliance with SEC and NYSE rules and regulations
  • Partner with co-workers who are sharp and motivated, combined with a company culture that is inclusive, stimulating, and unequaled

What You Bring Along:

You have excellent judgment, are able to balance competing demands on your time, independently function in a fast-paced environment, and can handle ambiguity and rapidly shifting priorities with flexibility, patience and humor. We’re looking for someone with the ability to learn quickly and enthusiastically, who is also effective at collaborating across multiple teams and building positive relationships.

Moreover, you have/are:

  • Between approximately 5 and 8 years of corporate law experience in a top law firm and maybe even in-house (the latter is preferred, not mandatory)
  • Juris Doctor degree from a top law school
  • Eager to jump in and do whatever needs doing, whether or not it fits squarely in your area of expertise
  • Excellent organizational skills, meticulously thorough, and proud to ensure nothing is missed
  • Strong strategic and problem-solving capabilities
  • The ability to prioritize and drive to results
  • An excellent work ethic
  • Unfailingly discreet, able to take care of confidential and often highly sensitive information with the utmost care
  • Prior experience working in-house or onsite at a fast-growing or startup technology company (preferred, not mandatory)

Additional Information:

We provide:

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary.
  • Stock options
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave (moms & dads).
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off.
  • An environment in which you can balance satisfying work with a great life.
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
  • Distributed-first company with Elasticians in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages.

#LI-KE1

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Apply for job

items.content:
Spanish Distance Learning Associate Language Instructor at Yorktown Systems Group

Remote | Entry-level | Part-time

EOE STATEMENT: Yorktown Systems Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. As part of the company’s equal employment opportunity policy, Yorktown Systems Group, Inc. will also take affirmative action as called for by applicable laws and Executive Orders to ensure that minority group individuals, females, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, other protected veterans, Armed Forces service medal veterans, and qualified disabled persons are introduced into our workforce and considered for promotional opportunities.

ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION: Yorktown Systems Group, Inc. is a committed team of dedicated former military and civilian professionals who believe in providing ethical and quality services to Government customers. Our leadership team is composed primarily of Veterans who are now serving in a corporate environment rather than in uniform. Our customer’s missions become our own and we are committed to working as a team to achieve success.

Because of the depth and experiences of our corporate leadership, we can assure all our customers that “we will do what we say we can do” and will focus on our customer’s missions rather than corporate goals. Our business model is based on a personal commitment from our leaders to maintain contact with our customers to continually and consistently gauge our performance.

Yorktown Systems Group was founded on the idea that providing quality and ethical services with a laser focus on our customer’s goals is an effective long-term business model. Our mission, therefore, is to help our customers meet their requirements and goals.

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because such employee or applicant has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed the compensation of the employee or applicant or another employee or applicant. This provision shall not apply to instances in which an employee who has access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of such employee’s essential job functions discloses the compensation of such other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to such information, unless such disclosure is in response to a formal complaint or charge, in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or is consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

CATEGORY: Education

DESCRIPTION

Summary:

Spanish Distant Learning Associate Language Instructor will assist the 1st Special Forces Command which has an ongoing requirement for web-based, Distance Learning (DL) foreign Language, Regional Expertise, and Cultural (LREC) instruction and LREC program support services.

Specific duties may include, but are not limited to:

  • Provide tailored and modular web-based language instruction to improve foreign language speaking and listening skills increasing ACTFL or Oral Proficiency Interview (OPI) scores by 1/2 a point or more.
  • Provide web-based instruction in listening, reading, writing, and speaking skills, as well as regional and culture subjects, using modern communicative methodology.
  • Develop learning materials, as required.
  • Employ computer skills to organize data and teaching materials.
  • Execute ad hoc tutoring sessions based on student requirements.
  • Teach language curriculum based on designated POI in some cases.
  • Possess the ability to teach on the spot upon contact with the student based on student interest and levels varying from ILR 0+ – 3, take attendance, make daily annotations of student’s learning and behavior progress or lack of, develop weekly progress reports.
  • Review, correct, and grade daily homework, discuss and provide feedback to the student.
  • Review, distribute, and grade assessments/quizzes if requested by the student when assigned.
  • Maintain a positive and professional web-based learning environment, telephonic environment, chat message environment address student behavior/attendance concerns with site lead, and utilize designated materials mentioned in POI and other products approved by GOVT to support instruction.
  • Collaborate with Site Lead, POI analyst, or Language Instructional Developer to address student and curriculum gaps.

Required Qualifications:

  • Experienced and knowledgeable in language and cultural education.
  • Measurable past performance of improving students speaking and listening capabilities.
  • Thorough understanding of customs and cultural components pertaining to the target language common to its region of predominate use.
  • Native or near native language capability.
  • Practice customs and culture common to the target language and its region of predominate use.

Desired Qualifications:

  • Experience using online platforms, such as CL-150 or Blackboard

Clearance: None.

Location: Remote

Travel: No travel required

FULL-TIME/PART-TIME: Part-Time

EXEMPT/NON-EXEMPT: Non-Exempt

LOCATION: Remote

items.content:
Retirement Plan Consultant at Ascensus

Remote
  • Location: US
  • Level: Full time
  • Category: Client Services

Description

Position Purpose:

Serve as a resource to plan sponsors and financial advisors for matters related to ERISA compliance, plan design and governmental reporting. Use experience and knowledge to serve as a resource to internal associates

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Heads project teams and or provides training for Consultants or Assistants
  • Serves as technical resource for Consultants and Assistants
  • Provide superior customer service, including problem solving with minimal inconvenience to clients
  • Provides effective and timely verbal and written communications in a clear, concise and informative written manner
  • Assists the client with all initial and ongoing plan design and document support
  • Assists the clients in meeting all IRS and Department of Labor deadlines necessary for qualified retirement plan
  • Maintains up-to date knowledge of present legislation and proposed legislative changes with regard to ERISA law through self study and company-sponsored training sessions
  • Responsible for all aspects of valuation reports, participant statements and annual testing
  • Reviews or performs, as needed, the annual testing for plans, including ADP/ACP, Top Heavy, 410(b), 415, 401(a)(4),deductibility, and 402(g)
  • Reviews distribution paperwork and coordinates processing of distributions with asset holder
  • Reviews loan paperwork and coordinates processing of loans with asset holder
  • Reviews or prepares Form 5500 and coordinates with plan sponsor to help ensure timely filing
  • Assists auditors if a plan is subject to an audit
  • Assists IRS and DOL auditors, if the plan is subject to an IRS or DOL audit
  • Coordinate with all applicable parties, both internal and external, to ensure accurate conversion process for new clients
  • As applicable, work with assistant to coordinate and oversee activities that will ensure timely and accurate completion of book of business
  • Responsible for protecting, securing, and proper handling of all confidential data held by Ascensus to ensure against unauthorized access, improper transmission, and/or unapproved disclosure of information that could result in harm to Ascensus or our clients.
  • The I-Client philosophy and the Core Values of People Matter, Quality First and Integrity Always® should be visible in your actions on a day to day basis showing your support of our organizational culture.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree preferred
  • 3-5 years ERISA experience in the retirement industry
  • Experience in analysis of financial data required
  • Experience in Relius software desirable, but not required
  • Strong Word, Excel, and Outlook skills
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritize, manage tasks and meet in connection with business operations, including related ERISA compliance matters
  • Ability to effectively plan and assign work and supervise support staff

Ascensus is a place to have a career, not just a job. As the largest US independent retirement and college savings services provider, we put our focus on people. Our culture is guided by sound principles, is committed to high standards, operates with transparency, and welcomes diversity. When you join our team, you get to go to work every day knowing that you help over 6 million Americans save for retirement and college.

Ascensus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, religion, age, citizenship, sex, marital or veteran status, disability or handicap, sexual orientation or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Ascensus also takes affirmative action to employ, and advance in employment, qualified women, minorities, and covered veterans. Ascensus also makes reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities, in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state laws

items.title: Professor, Human Resources
items.content:
Professor, Human Resources at Northcentral University

Remote

Academics

Remote, United States

Description

What We Are Looking For

The School of Business (SB) at Northcentral University seeks applications for a non-tenure track, Assistant, Associate, or Full Professor in Human Resources.

Full-time Professors may teach undergraduate and/or graduate courses within a programmatic core discipline as assigned and/or guide doctoral candidates through doctoral dissertation requirements (as Chair or committee member). This position also provides content expertise to the Dean in areas of criminal justice. Primary responsibility is to engage students, offer excellent feedback, and inspire students to achieve course and program outcomes relevant to the core discipline. This position works closely with other faculty teaching in the discipline, Associate Director of Faculty Support and Development, Assistant Dean and Dean.

Essential Functions

The role of Professor may include teaching courses within a programmatic core discipline as assigned, acting as a Dissertation Chair or Committee Member, acting as a content expert for course development, research, participation in shared governance, and service to the university community.

  • Demonstrates a commitment to Northcentral’s vision, mission, and goals and those of the School of Business.
  • Promotes a graduate culture of scholarship, teaching, service, and practice.
  • Demonstrates commitment to and capacity for Teaching through Engagement and using the NCU One-to-One, apprenticeship style teaching model.
  • Teaches masters and/or doctoral courses in human resources or related disciplines .
  • Participates in initial and ongoing training.
  • Contributes to developing training materials and provides input on improving training, courses, and processes.
  • Participates in trial use of new technologies and integrates new technologies into their teaching.
  • Participates in faculty and staff meetings.
  • Maintains contact with students via phone, video conferencing, email, and other tools provided for synchronous or asynchronous communication through their courses.
  • Works collaboratively with Academic Advisors to ensure student engagement and success.
  • Exercises academic freedom in teaching course content and achieving learning outcomes in accordance with University policy, procedures, and curricula.
  • Participates in institutional and student learning outcomes assessment procedures, program, department review, and accreditation efforts.
  • Performs all educational services in accordance with NCU policies and procedures, the Family Education Rights to Privacy Act, Northcentral University’s Code of Conduct and all other state and federal laws.
  • Adheres to policies and requirements defined in the Faculty Handbook.
  • Tasks and projects as assigned by the Dean, or NCU administrators.
  • Reasonable and consistent attendance to fulfill requirements of the position.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Skill in verbal and written communication.
  • Skill in operating equipment, such as personal computer, copier, phone systems.
  • Ability to evaluate information to make informed and responsive decisions on matters that impact university stakeholders.
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, and governing body regulations.
  • Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
  • Ability to identify problems, collect information, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and recommend and implement policies and processes to advance continuous improvement efforts.
  • Ability to process, analyze, and present qualitative and quantitative data.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills, with a proven ability to provide timely, accurate information on a variety of academically oriented subjects to both internal and external constituents.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Word and other application in the Microsoft Office suite.

Education an Experience

  • Doctorate degree in Human Resources, HR Management, or closely related field from a regionally accredited institution.
  • 5 years of field experience in the above specilization, administrative or command experience preferred
  • 2 years of direct teaching experience at the Master and/or Doctoral level.
  • PHR, SHRM certification preferred.
  • Curriculum development experience preferred.
  • Experience with the online delivery modality of higher education.
  • Experience working as a remote employee preferred.
  • Experience in Higher Education preferred.
  • Experience working in a technology-driven enterprise preferred.
  • All skills, abilities and education will be considered for minimum qualifications.

Working Conditions

This position operates in a remote, home office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, printers, and phones.

NCU will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Who We Are

Northcentral University (NCU) is a private, nonprofit, online University and a proud affiliate of the National University System with its headquarters in California. We are a graduate university, and a global leader in providing access to regionally-accredited higher education.

NCU offers doctoral, master’s and bachelor’s degrees in business, education, and psychology, as well as doctoral and master’s degrees in technology, health sciences and marriage and family therapy. Our collective goal at Northcentral University is to improve the human condition through the provision of high-quality online degree programs.

NCU was founded in 1996 to provide working professionals around the world with access to a richly- engaging, professionally-relevant, and academically-rigorous educational programs. Today, we continue to serve that mission. Many students at NCU are first-generation graduate students seeking to contribute to their communities through their pursuit of academic growth, research, and practice.

Though we support faculty and student research, NCU is a teaching university. Our faculty dedicate themselves to serving students through a pedagogical model of Teaching through Engagement (TTE). The goal is for all NCU students, faculty and team members to be actively engaged within the University community. Engagement is more than just grading and giving feedback, it is an active relationship between faculty and student, a give and take of ideas and information.

NCU offers a one-to-one learning model, where one student is paired with one professor in each course, creating a more personalized, individual experience for students. These experiences are enhanced by professors’ real-world, practical experience. All NCU faculty hold doctoral degrees.

At NCU, we are widening access to education and reducing educational divides. We are proud of the educational opportunities that we provide, and we recognize that providing this kind of access to all students takes work and collaborative effort. We value diversity of people, thoughts, and ideas. Our global reach affords us the opportunity to teach and learn the significance of diversity – and the power it brings to our endeavors.

Are you ready to take advantage of this exciting opportunity to join a growing team of passionate individuals who work together to help others fulfill their dreams through higher education?

Apply for job

items.content:
Fachberater Prozessautomatisierung für Versicherungen (m/w/d) (REMOTE – Deutschlandweit) // camunda

Company: camunda

Tags:
  • German
  • Automation
  • Consultant
  • process
  • Versicherungen
  • Fachberatung
  • Prozessautomatisierung

    • BESCHREIBUNG

    Camunda ist eines der am schnellsten wachsenden IT-Unternehmen in Europa. Wir sind ein über 130 Mitarbeiter starkes und hochmotiviertes Team mit Hauptsitz in Berlin und Büros in San Francisco und Denver. Wir bieten eine innovative Open Source-Plattform, mit der wir Unternehmen dabei helfen, ihre Geschäftsprozesse zu automatisieren.

    Mit diesem Angebot sind wir sehr erfolgreich. Mittlerweile ist Camunda bei mehr als 250 Kunden im Einsatz, darunter nicht nur Unternehmen wie AT&T, Zalando, T-Mobile und Universal, sondern auch über 30 Versicherer in Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz. Camunda wird bei diesen Versicherern vor allem in der Digitalisierung ihrer Antrags- und Leistungsprozesse eingesetzt.

    Neben dieser innovativen Technologie ist dabei insbesondere auch unsere große Kompetenz und Praxiserfahrung im Bereich der Prozessautomatisierung und der Digitalisierung von Geschäftsmodellen ein wesentliches Element, warum sich Unternehmen für Camunda entscheiden. Als “Fachberater Prozessautomatisierung für Versicherungen” bist Du daher eine zentrale Schlüsselperson, um Entscheider in Versicherungen bei der Identifikation, Planung und Umsetzung ihrer Digitalisierungsprojekte zu unterstützen und um sicherzustellen, dass Versicherer alle Potentiale unserer Technologie nutzen.

    DEINE TÄTIGKEITEN:

    • Bei unseren Versicherungskunden bist Du ein wichtiges Bindeglied zwischen Fachabteilungen und der IT. Dein Ziel ist es, neue Camunda-Projekte an den Start zu bringen
    • Du hilfst Fachabteilungen, Schmerzpunkte sowie Verbesserungs- und Digitalisierungspotentiale in ihren Prozessen zu identifizieren
    • Du unterstützt dabei, aus Projektideen strukturierte Prozess- und Projektbeschreibungen abzuleiten, konkrete Anforderungen zu beschreiben, Umsetzungsaufwände abzuschätzen und Projektbudgets zu planen
    • Du stellst den IT-Teams fachliche Anforderungen vor und erstellst mit ihnen gemeinsam passende Lösungsarchitekturen und priorisierte Featurelisten
    • Durch Deinen guten Überblick über anstehende und laufende Projekte, zeigst Du Entscheidern Projektabhängigkeiten auf und unterstützt bei der Priorisierung ihres Projektportfolios
    • In Umsetzungsprojekten steht Du den Teams als Prozessautomatisierung-Experte zur Verfügung, führst Prozess-Reviews durch und trägst nachhaltig zum Projekterfolg bei

    WEN WIR SUCHEN:

    • Du bist ein Versicherungs-Insider – Du kennst die Geschäftsmodelle, Prozesse und Unternehmenskultur von Versicherungen genauso so gut wie ihre aktuellen Herausforderungen
    • Mit Deiner mindestens 10-jährigen Berufserfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche fällt es Dir leicht, Problemstellungen von Fachabteilungen zu verstehen, Optimierungspotentiale aufzuzeigen und daraus Camunda-Projekte abzuleiten
    • Du hast einen starken IT-Hintergrund, kennst moderne IT-Architekturen, Technologien und Softwareentwicklungsmethoden und weißt wie man sie im Unternehmenskontext einsetzt
    • Du hast Freude daran, mit Menschen zu interagieren, Workshops oder Trainings zu leiten und als Experte für Prozessautomatisierung im Mittelpunkt zu stehen
    • Dir fällt es leicht, komplexe Sachverhalte schnell zu verstehen und sie verständlich zu erklären
    • Du bist ein Macher – sobald Du klare Ziele bekommst, findest Du selbständig Deinen Weg, sie zu erreichen
    • In dieser Rolle bist Du meist vor Ort bei unseren Kunden, d.h. Du kannst problemlos innerhalb Deutschlands reisen
    • Du beherrschst Deutsch Wort und Schrift sicher

    DEIN ARBEITSORT:

    Camunda begreift sich als verteilte Organisation – für uns ist es nicht entscheidend, von welchem Ort aus Du arbeitest. Viel wichtiger ist es uns, mit herausragenden Talenten zusammenzuarbeiten, die ihrer Tätigkeit mit Leidenschaft, Spaß und Begeisterung nachgehen. Daher kannst Du Deinen Arbeitsort frei wählen. Da Du regelmäßig reisen wirst, ist es jedoch wichtig, dass ein Bahnhof und ein Flughafen für Dich in erreichbarer Nähe sind.

    WAS WIR DIR BIETEN:

    • Wir sind ein schnell wachsendes, profitables und stabiles Startup mit einer Glassdoor-Bewertung von 4,9
    • Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten sowie viel Raum für eigene Ideen
    • Ein hochmotiviertes Team, regelmäßiger Erfahrungsaustausch und viel Spaß bei der Arbeit
    • Flexible Arbeitsbedingungen und die Möglichkeit, von zu Hause aus zu arbeiten.
    • Wahlfreiheit bei Deiner technischen Ausstattung, z.B. Mac oder Linux oder Windows
    • Kostenlose Sport-Club Mitgliedschaft und Englischunterricht
    • In unserem Büro in Berlin: freie Getränke, Obst, Cerealien, Snacks, Eis und Bier (natürlich selbst gebraut).
    • Viele weitere gute Gründe für Camunda https://camunda.com/de/career/

    Camunda ist ein Arbeitgeber mit Chancengleichheit für alle – wir schätzen Vielfalt in unserem Unternehmen.

    Apply for this position

items.title: Review Nurse – Quality
items.content:
Review Nurse – Quality at CareCentrix

Remote

Job Locations: Remote

Job ID: 2019-7695

Category: Clinical/Utilization Management

Overview

Imagine being able to shape the healthcare industry where people can heal and age at home

The Quality Review Nurse (QRN) is responsible for supporting quality improvement initiatives aimed at achieving and maintaining a high standard of care and service excellence to CareCentrix’s patients, Health Plan customers, and accredited Providers.

The QRN accomplishes this through involvement in quality projects and in participating in the end-to-end auditing process including data sampling, file extraction, analysis, trending and reporting of clinical and service indicators and recommendations as needed.

CareCentrix is a growing organization and we are seeking dedicated individuals to be a part of this exciting and rewarding business. We offer competitive pay plus bonus and a full benefit package including PTO, health, dental, vision, 401K, tuition reimbursement, and more!

Primary Responsibilities

  • This position of Quality Review Nurse assists in the clinical quality of care review process, the medical record audit process for the delegation oversight, quantitative and qualitative analysis of data & transformation in information that can be reported
  • Performs delegation oversight activities including auditing medical record against Medical Care guidelines, scope of professional practice standards and policies and procedures, etc., to determine compliance with established standards
  • Assists in developing oversight tools and processes for clinical quality
  • Extracts data from systems and records and conducts quantitative and qualitative analysis of data and transformation into information that can be reported
  • Works with account/network management and/or Provider Services staff to ensure provider understanding and compliance with required elements of delegated functions
  • Works with clinical review staff to ensure compliance with delegated functions
  • Participates in and contributes to performance improvement activities through clinical review of complex cases and coaching activities to expand and develop clinical skill for licensed associates.

Qualifications

  • Associate Degree required, with Bachelor’s or Master’s degree preferred.
  • Current Registered Nurse license in the state(s) of practice without restrictions and a strong clinical background as an RN (minimum of 5 years)
  • Certified Professional Health Care Quality (CPHQ) preferred.
  • 3-5 years of Quality Management and/or UM in a managed care environment
  • Prior experience with medical record review, complaint review, investigation and tracking.
  • Past experience with data collection and analysis of indicators for monitoring and evaluation of quality, appropriateness and timeliness of care and service, and customer satisfaction
Apply for job

We consult, form a diverse team of experts, and deliver strategy and execution all under one roof.Our services range from new product development, pure R&D, legacy modernization, pricing strategy development, revenue generation, process optimization, to organizational transformation and cultural design.Working at TheoremAt Theorem, we believe that creating an environment where great people can flourish is the best strategy for our business and the best way to solve our client's problems and deliver the greatest value.Our focus on culture is supported by our shared vision to build a company where we want to work for the long-term. items.title: Director, Medical Writing

Director, Medical Writing at Meet Recruitment

Remote | High-paying

  • Salary: $180,000 – 200,000

Job Summary

Rare medical writing opportunity to serve as a Director on a remote basis! Do not miss out on the opportunity to join an innovative and impactful clinical-stage biopharma in a senior-level role. Suited to highly experienced medical writers in search of a dynamic environment.

Job Overview

COMPANY BACKGROUND:
Meet’s client is a biopharmaceutical company working within rare diseases with a specific focus on debilitating genetic diseases. Their goal is to develop cost-efficient therapies and products to those with high unmet medical needs. Based in northern California, they have been around for about 10 years and already have 4 approved drugs within the space and a very active pipeline currently (mainly in CNS, Musculoskeletal, and Hormonal Systems). They are a mid-size company with about 500 employees.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ensure all medical writing deliverables are of quality and completed in a timely fashion
  • Mentor/manage junior writers
  • Write and or coordinate the writing of clinical and regulatory documents such as CSRs, IBs,
  • protocols, etc.
  • Serve as a leader of the department through the proposal and oversight of new initiatives
  • Develop/maintain outlines and templates for medical writing deliverables

Skills Required

  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in scientific or medical field (advance degree preferred)
  • 15+ years’ experience working within medical writing (submissions experience highly preferred)
  • Strong leadership capabilities

items.title: Tax Wrangler
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Tax Wrangler at Automattic

Remote | International

At Automattic, we are the people behind WordPress.com, WooCommerce, and Jetpack. We believe in making the web a better place. We’re a distributed company with 800+ Automatticians in 65+ countries speaking 75+ languages. Our shared goal is to democratize publishing so that anyone with a story can tell it, regardless of income, gender, politics, language, or where they live in the world.

As part of Automattic’s accounting team, we spend every single day helping our company and our investors make better decisions. We design and implement tax policies and procedures for a SaaS business with millions of subscribers. We work with tax authorities around the world. We report our results, at a public-company standard, internally and to sophisticated institutional investors. We meet tax and other statutory obligations globally. When we are not doing all of that, we do a lot of special projects. This position is focused on non-U.S. taxes.

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You have worked on non-U.S. indirect taxes like VAT/GST for at least two years.
  • You have experience in non-U.S. statutory filings and income tax returns for multiple countries.
  • You enjoy researching various non-U.S. tax laws and regulations.
  • You wake up eager to check out the latest indirect tax news hitting your inbox.
  • You love a dynamic, lean, fast-growing environment.
  • You are highly motivated to learn new things and improve your skills.
  • You have excellent verbal and written skills in English.

If you have experience with WordPress, software development, coding, open source, SaaS or other relevant areas, don’t forget to mention it. Also, if you have your CPA or equivalent or are working towards one, mention that too. Like all positions at Automattic, you’ll work remotely, and can be based wherever you live.

We’re serious about growing diversity in the tech industry. We want to build Automattic as an environment where people love their work and show respect and empathy to those with whom we interact. Diversity typically includes, but is not limited to, differences in race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, political and religious affiliation, socioeconomic background, cultural background, geographic location, disabilities and abilities, relationship status, veteran status, and age. To work on diversity means that we welcome these differences, and strive to increase the visibility of traditionally underrepresented groups. Read more about our dedication to diversity and inclusion.

Apply for job

items.title: Commercial Director - Maternity Cover to permanent
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Turing Fest is the top cross-functional tech conference in Europe and the go-to tech event in Scotland. Our purpose is to create events and connections that drive the growth of the tech ecosystem in Scotland, and beyond.


Currently, we run three events throughout the year, and we will be adding 1-2 additional events each year as we work to expand our reach and our brand. Our Commercial Director will be heading on maternity leave for the bulk of 2020.  We are looking for a maternity cover for her, with the option/potential to stay in the business after her return at the end of 2020. 


The ideal candidate will be an experienced seller in the events industry who is looking for an autonomous role that gives them an enormous amount of flexibility. We are a remote team with an HQ in Edinburgh so we can be flexible with your geographic location, as long as it is in Europe! You will have the option to join a coworking space with other colleagues if you are based in London, on your own if based in another Euopean city, or work from home if appropriate. If you are based in Edinburgh, you will have a desk in our HQ with the bulk of the team. 


If you have a proven track record, this role can be what you make of it. 


Responsibilities:



  • Achieve set revenue targets for the commercial division 

  • Sell sponsorships for the following events through a combination of personalised outreach and macro campaigns:


    • The Next Gen 2020 (4 dinners/year; once per quarter)

    • Turing Founders

    • Turing Fest

    • Scottish Tech Startup Awards

    • Pending FinTech Event

    • Pending Marketing event




  • Help adapt and shape the sponsorship offerings for the various events throughout the year

  • Manage the entire sales process from start to finish (initial outreach through to contract)

  • Work closely with Marketing and Operations teams to ensure cohesion and fluid execution in the run up to, during, and after each event 

  • Form lasting relationships with our network 

  • Keep meticulous records in company CRM system

  • Attend various events around the world


Benefits:



  • Excellent Bonus Structure 

  • Flexible working

  • Opportunity to travel the world for various events

  • Pension

  • Part of a dynamic, growing team with a well-respected and expanding brand

  • Have a direct impact on our future growth

items.title: Principal Consultant Enterprise Architect at ERNI Schweiz AG
items.content:
Principal Consultant Enterprise Architect

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Agile Software Development, Business Intelligence, IT Consulting
Company size: 501–1k people
Company type: Private
Company: ERNI Schweiz AG | No office location

Technologies

enterprise-architect

Job description

Seit 1994 beraten und unterstützen wir Unternehmen in Innovation und Technologie mit dem Ziel, die unternehmerische Leistungsfähigkeit unserer Kunden zu steigern und damit den Weg ins digitale Morgen zu ebnen. Ein von schweizerischen Werten geprägter Mindset ist der Schlüssel zu unserem Erfolg in einem globalen Markt. Wir wollen, dass unsere Kunden effektiver und innovativer sind. Gemeinsam erreichen wir hochgesteckte Ziele, weil wir auf partnerschaftliche Zusammenarbeit setzen. Wir gestalten Prozesse so einfach und smart wie möglich – mit rund 800 Mitarbeitenden an 15 Standorten in 6 Ländern.

Verantwortlichkeiten:

  • Abhängig von Erfahrung und Präferenzen werden für unsere Kunden aus unterschiedlichen Branchen erfolgreich ICT Projekte umgesetzt
  • Von der Kundenakquisition bis zum erfolgreichen Abschluss eines Projektes wird starkes Know-how in der Beratung, sowie in der Umsetzung von ICT Architekturkonzepten erwartet
  • Beratung unseren Kunden bei nachhaltigen Architekturentscheidungen, sowie Findung der optimalen Lösung bei der Wahl der einzusetzenden Technologien
  • Unterstützung von Firmen bei der Umsetzung von digitalen Transformationen mittels Coverage Analysen in Workshops und Facilitation Sessions
  • Hilfestellung für unsere Kunden, um ihre Unternehmungsstrategie zu analysieren und ihre Geschäftsvision auszuarbeiten. Davon abgeleitet werden Vorschläge für die ICT Strategie, Systemlandschaften entworfen und modelliert, nachhaltige Architekturentscheidungen getroffen und Architekturartefakte verwaltet
  • Schlüsselperson in der Kommunikation zwischen fachlichen und technischen Stakeholdern

Dein Profil:

  • Hochschulabschluss (ETH, FH, Uni) in Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik
  • Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung in zwei der folgenden Domänen: Banken & Insurance, Verwaltung, Transport & Logistik, Medizinische Technologie, Fachdienstleistung, Produktionsindustrie
  • Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung als Enterprise Architekt
  • Erfahrung im Entwurf und Implementierung von Geschäftsvisionen
  • Erfahrung in der Durchführung von Analysen mittels Workshops (z.B. Coverage Analysen)
  • Erfahrung in der Beratung bei Architektur- und Technologiefragen
  • Erfahrung in Digital Business Transformation und Innovation von Vorteil
  • Eine kommunikations- und durchsetzungsstarke Persönlichkeit
  • Mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in der Projektleitung und in der Beratung
  • Gute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • TOGAF oder ähnliche Zertifizierung und Account Management Erfahrung von Vorteil

ERNI bietet Ihnen ein internationales Arbeitsumfeld, schätzt Ihre Motivation bei der Arbeit und gibt Ihnen gerne Verantwortung. Bei Herausforderungen stehen wir unterstützend zur Seite. Ihre persönliche Weiterentwicklung im Unternehmen begleiten wir Ihren Bedürfnissen und Wünschen entsprechend – mit einem persönlichen Entwicklungsplan, kontinuierlichem Austausch in Communities und den ERNI Development Days, Fachtrainings und einem Team das hilfsbereit und begeisternd ist. Wir wissen, dass uns Ihr Talent und Ihre Tatkraft weiter nach vorne bringen und sind Ihnen partnerschaftlicher Arbeitgeber mit offenem Ohr und lebendiger Wir-Kultur.
Möchten Sie mehr über ERNI und Ihre Aussichten bei uns erfahren? betterask.erni

Apply now

Benefits

  • International work environment
  • Established ERNI community with learning and team-building events
  • Continuous skill development
  • Standardised and established career path
  • Equal opportunities
  • 16 weeks maternity leave (100%)
  • Possibility of taking unpaid leave

items.content:
Remote Coach

Quit Genius is a multi award-winning mobile therapy program to help smokers quit for good. Since launching in June 2017 we've experienced incredible user growth and are already the world leaders in smoking cessation. The app works - we’ve published 3 peer-reviewed papers and have already helped over 100,000 people quit smoking, for good. What we do saves lives and hearing all the incredible positive feedback from our users on a daily basis is incredibly rewarding. 

Our team made up of doctors, designers and engineers who have a passion to make a positive impact on the lives of people around the world. We're a team of lifelong learners and we want to work with like-minded people who care about devoting their time to building products that can have a real impact on the lives of millions of people around the world.
 
Role description


We're looking for a full-time Quit Coach to join the team. Within the app, certain users have the ability to speak one-to-one (text chat) with a psychologist. You will be checking in with these users on a weekly basis (through text chat on the app and on the phone) and be on hand when they are experiencing any difficulties. This isn’t a one-off job - we want to bring someone on board for the long-term and integrate them into our awesome team :) You will work closely with the whole team contributing to the fast growth of the business and gaining first-hand experience of what it takes to scale up a successful business.


What you’ll do:



  • Speak to users on a weekly basis through text-based chat and check-in with them to see how they are progressing on their quit smoking journey.

  • Onboard the users with a short initial phone call.

  • Offer advice on how to deal with their cravings and any difficult situations. 

  • Be supportive and encouraging to users to motivate them on their quit smoking journey.

  • Monitor the progress of users.

  • Help someone transform their life and the life of their family by quitting smoking, for good!



Requirements:



  • At least two years of experience delivering CBT and/or smoking cessation behavioral support.

  • NCSCT Certified Qualifications

  • Good availability during the week to take onboarding calls and speak to users

  • Psychology and/or clinical background

  • Very strong communication skills

  • Tech-savvy

  • Bonus: quantitative/qualitative research experience



Perks:


  • Flexible work schedule, unlimited holidays and opportunity to work remote too. 

  • Work with a talented, passionate and ambitious team of doctors, designers and technologists. 

  • Gaining first-hand experience of what it takes to scale a successful business. 

  • The opportunity to make a big impact. What we do saves lives.

  • Opportunity for rapid career progression.



Please read all the above and only apply if you meet all requirements. Please submit your full CV with a detailed cover letter outlining your experience and an explanation of why you are suitable for this role.

Développeur Unity - télétravail

About this job

Job type: Contract
Role: Graphics/Game Developer
Industry: Creative Services, iOS, Mobile Application
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Tayasui | No office location

Technologies

unity3d

Job description

Tayasui, studio de création parisien, développe depuis 10 ans quelques-unes des applications les plus populaires et plébiscitées de l'App Store : Tayasui Sketches, Talking Carl, Tayasui Color, Memopad...

Vous avez envie de travailler sur des projets créatifs ?
Vous voulez expérimenter les dernières technos, AR et VR ?
Vous souhaitez revendiquer la création d'applications de tout premier plan et les voir vivre entre des millions de mains?
Vous appréciez une certaine autonomie et la dynamique d'une petite équipe?
Nous sommes l'endroit rêvé pour vous réaliser.

Sous la responsabilité directe du directeur créatif, vous serez en charge du développement de nos applications sous Unity.

Indispensable :
Avoir au minimum 2 ans d'expérience Unity sur iOS

Curieux et Intéressé par les tous derniers développements

Être capable de reprendre des projets existants
Un souci permanent de la qualité de l'expérience utilisateur

Nous offrons :

L'opportunité de travailler sur des applications au rayonnement mondial
Des projets variés, artistiques et stimulants
Un salaire attractif
Freelance, CDI ou CDD selon votre choix

Apply now

Benefits

items.title: Sr Consultant Digital Transfomation- Remote
items.content:
Job Description - Sr Consultant Digital Transfomation- Remote ()Job Description Sr Consultant Digital Transfomation- Remote - ()Description This role can be located anywhere in the US/Remote. This role is responsible for leading digital marketing efforts targeting small and midsize businesses to achieve superior customer engagement and intimacy, website traffic and high-quality leads that drive demand generation by strategically exploiting all aspects of the digital marketing planning, development and implementation. Digital marketing efforts include search engine optimization (SEO), search engine marketing (SEM), social media, digital / social media advertising and website strategy/roadmap and content. This person will be an integral part of a high-performing marketing team working with and managing third party vendors applying best practices, testing results and performance analysis to generate demand. Roles/Responsibilities SEM/SEO/Display duties include: · Develop branded and unbranded paid search campaigns, including keyword research, ad copy, targeting, reporting, media budgets and regular program optimization, in support of business unit revenue and demand generation objectives. · Develop display campaigns for both brand awareness and lead generation efforts, managing budgets, targeting and optimizations. · Manage digital agencies to drive an increase in clicks, calls/leads and overall revenue while balancing expense. · Develop and implement SEO strategy to drive an increase in search ranking, increase organic website traffic and organic leads while working with subject matter content experts. · Keep up to date on the latest trends and concepts in SEO and SEM, as well as changes to Google/other search engine algorithm changes and ensure that content is updated for continued search performance. Social Media duties include: · Develop a robust social media strategy that reaches the target customers and increases brand awareness, builds thought leadership, promotes key business initiatives, and assists in increasing website traffic and leads. · Develop and manage a series of content working with product, marketing and care experts to increase social media channel audience and engagement as well as to manage the social media platform for improved sharing. · Develop and manage social care strategy, increase online reputation, including working with Care to monitor social media sites for Kinetic Business mentions, escalating customer care issues. Website duties include: · Develop a strategic plan for continuous improvement of the website for increased engagement and conversion to high-quality leads. · Work with webmaster and IT to implement the changes to the website as outlined in the strategic plan as well as to implement the necessary updates required to support product launches, service enhancements and/or improved content and/or creative. Work closely with IT to develop a strategic roadmap for an optimized digital omnichannel strategy that support the revenue objectives established Qualifications Minimum Requirements: College degree and 8 years professional level experience with 3-4 years supervisory experience; or 12 years professional level related experience with 3-4 years supervisory experience; or an equivalent combination of education and professional level related experience required. Preferred Experience · Expertise in demand generation strategies and execution focused on best practices · Experience in messaging and testing for optimized results · Experience with Google Analytics · Experience working with Kentico · A high-level understanding of Marketo integration with the website · Experience working with senior level business owners in defining reporting and data requirements · Experience in vendor management · Experience in matrix management of a cross-functional team of contributors Independent worker with strong initiative and results-orientedProficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook) · B2B marketing experience, preferably in the telecom or technology industries Flexible travel requirements up to 15%IND123 Primary Location: US-Arkansas-Little RockOther Locations: US-Colorado-Denver, US-Texas-Dallas, US-North Carolina-Charlotte, US-New York-New York, United States, US-Georgia-Atlanta, US-Illinois-ChicagoWork Locations: Little Rock AR 4001 N Rodney P 4001 N Rodney Parham Rd Little Rock 72212Job Category: MarketingEEO Statement: Employment at Windstream is subject to post offer, pre-employment drug testing. Equal Opportunity Employer including minority/female/disability/veteran; Without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or employment status. Windstream is a drug-free workplace.

by Jobble
